meanings.definition: The technique of selecting, editing, and piecing together separate sections of film to form a continuous whole.
meanings.sent1: The filmmaker used a montage to show the passage of time in the movie.
meanings.sent2: The montage of scenes from different angles created a seamless transition in the film.
meanings.sent3: During the montage, the characters seemed to be dancing through different moments in their lives.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a montage of memories, each one blending into the next.
meanings.sent5: The montage of colors and sounds in the film left a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: A single pictorial composition made by juxtaposing or superimposing many pictures or designs.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a beautiful montage of flowers and butterflies in the painting.
meanings.sent2: The magazine cover featured a stunning montage of city landmarks.
meanings.sent3: The montage of animals wearing hats in the artwork made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit was a stylish montage of patterns and textures.
meanings.sent5: The montage of landscapes in the photograph captured the beauty of nature.

meanings.definition: A quick succession of images or impressions used to express an idea.
meanings.sent1: The advertisement used a montage of happy faces to promote the product.
meanings.sent2: The music video included a fast-paced montage of city streets and lights.
meanings.sent3: The montage of funny cat videos made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a powerful montage of emotions and experiences.
meanings.sent5: The montage of memories played in her mind like a vivid dream.
